title: 105_s170
content: The "Clone Pager Authorization Act of 1996" amends definitions in wire and electronic communications laws to include communication made through a clone pager. It also prohibits the use of pen registers, trap and trace devices, or clone pagers without authorization. Chapter 206 is amended accordingly. Chapter 206 of title 18, United States Code is amended to include clone pagers in addition to trap and trace devices. The chapter analysis and section 3121 are also updated to reflect this change. The amendment includes adding clone pagers to Chapter 206 of title 18, United States Code, alongside trap and trace devices. Sections 3121, 3122, and 3123 are updated to reflect this change. The amendment adds clone pagers to Chapter 206 of title 18, United States Code, alongside trap and trace devices. Section 3123 is updated to authorize the use of a pen register, trap and trace device, or a clone pager upon court approval. The amendment allows the use of a pen register, trap and trace device, or clone pager with court approval for ongoing criminal investigations. The amendment permits the use of a clone pager, in addition to a pen register and trap and trace device, with court approval for ongoing criminal investigations. The amendment allows the use of a clone pager, along with a pen register and trap and trace device, for ongoing criminal investigations with court approval. The amendment allows the use of a clone pager in addition to a pen register and trap and trace device for criminal investigations with court approval. A Federal court may order a provider of a paging service to furnish information to law enforcement upon request. The amendment permits the use of a clone pager alongside a pen register and trap and trace device for criminal investigations with court authorization. A Federal court can compel a paging service provider to provide necessary information to law enforcement. The amendment allows the use of a clone pager in addition to a pen register and trap and trace device for criminal investigations with court approval. Federal courts can require paging service providers to give information to law enforcement. The amendment allows the use of a clone pager for criminal investigations with court approval. A clone pager is defined as a device that receives communications intended for another paging device. The Senate passed the amendment on November 7, 1997. Attest: GARY SISCO, Secretary.
